titleStmt.title: John W. Finnell to Nathaniel Gaither, Jr.
CWG8374

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Military Appointments, 1859-1862

body.p:
UNITED WE STAND, DIVIDED WE FALL.
KENTUCKY.
Head-Quarters Kentucky Volunteer Militia,
ADJUTANT GENERAL'S OFFICE,
Frankfort, 26 May 1862.

Hon:
Nat Gaither Jr
Sec: of State-

The following resignations have taken place viz:
2 Lieut: James A. Foggle (date of Com. 19 Nov 1861)
1 Lieut: W. S. Dillehay ( " " " 16 Oct 1861)
1 Lieut: R. H. Turner ( " " " 15 Nov 1861)
2 Lieut: Geo. Wyatt ( " " " 9 Sep 1861)
Capt: W. T. Jackman ( " " " 28 March 1862)
2 Lieut: C. N. Janell ( " " " 26 Jan 1862)
2 Lieut: Obediah Bassham ( " " " 18 Nov 1861)
2 Lieut: Alexander Shiveley ( " " " 15 Feb 1862)
Capt: Anderson Gray ( " " " 13 Nov 1861)
1 Lieut: Boyd Mercer ( " " " 11 Nov 1861)
1 Lieut: W. B. Folger ( " " " 6 Feb 1862)
Capt: Charles Stewart ( " " " 16 Nov 1861)

And Commission which issued to Scott Robinson as 2d Lieut: has been cancelled
as he has recd another appointment (date of Com: 10 April 1862_

The following officer have been dismissed from the Service by order of Genl. Halleck viz:
1 Lieut: Sidney B. Jones (date of Com: 9 Oct 1861)
2 Lieut: F. M. Hardin ( " " " " " ")

I am Resply
John W. Finnell
Adjt Genl
